gurmukhi: sBu Cwr BieE dlu dwnv ko ijmu GUm hlwhl kI mKIAwN ]101]
transliteration: Sabh(u) Chhaad Bhaio Dal(u) Daavan Ko Jim(u) Ghoom Halaahal Koo Makhooaan||101||
translation: All the demon-army was reduced to ashes just as the bees are destroyed by the poisonous somoke.101.

gurmukhi: Aaur skl sYnw jrI bicE su eykY pRyq ]
transliteration: Aur Sakal Sainaa Daroo Bachio Su Ekai Pret||
translation: All the other army was burnt except the single demon.

gurmukhi: cMf bcwieE jwin kY Aaurn mwrn hyq ]102]
transliteration: Channd Bachadio Jaan(i0 Kai Auran Maaran Het||102||
translation: Chandi had deliberately saved him in order to kill others.102.

gurmukhi: Bwj inswcr mMd mq khI suMB pih jwie ]
transliteration: Bhaaj Nisaachar Mand Mat Kahoo Sounbh Pah(i0 Jaae||
translation: The foolish demon ran away and told the king sumbh;

gurmukhi: DUmRnYn sYnw sihq fwirE cMf Kpwie ]103]
transliteration: Dhoomranain Sainaa Sahit Daario Channd Khapaae||103||
translation: “Chandi hath destroyed Dhumar Lochan alongwith his army.103.

gurmukhi: skl kty Bt ktk ky pwiek rQ hY kuMB ]
transliteration: Sakal Kate Bhat Katak Ke Paaik Rath Hai Kounbh||
translation: “All the warriors of the army, those on foot, on chariots, horses and elephants have been killed.”

gurmukhi: XO suin bcn Acrj hÍY kop kIE niRp suMB ]104]
transliteration: Yau Soun(i) Bachanndacharaj Hvai Kip Ko( i)  Nrip Sounbh||104||
translation: Hearing these words and in astonishment, the king Sumbh became furious.104.

gurmukhi: cMf muMf dÍY dYq qb lIny suMB hkwr ]
transliteration: Channd Mounnd Dvai Dait Tab Loone Sounbh Hakaar||
translation: Then the king called two demons Chand and Mund;

gurmukhi: cil Awey niRp sBw mih kir lIny As Fwr ]105]
transliteration: Chal(i0 Aae Nrip Sabhaa Maih Kar(i0 Loone As Dhaar||105||
translation: Who came in the king’s court, holding sword and shield in their hands. 105.

gurmukhi: ABbMdn dono kIE bYTwey niRp qIr ]
transliteration: Abhbandan Dona Ko( i)  Baithaae Nrip Toor||
translation: Both of them bowed in obeisance to the king, who asked them to sit near him.

gurmukhi: pwn dey muK qy kihE qum dono mm bIr ]106]
transliteration: Paan Dae Moukh Te Kahio Toum Dono Mam Boor||106||
translation: And presenting them the seasoned and folded betel leaf, he uttered thus from his mouth; “Both of you are great heroes.”106.

gurmukhi: inj kt ko PYNtw dieE Aru jmDr krvwr ]
transliteration: Nij Kat Ko Phaintaa Daio Ar(u) Jamdhar Karvaar||
translation: The king gave them his waist-girdle, dagger and sword (and said);
